thread.title: Lafayette Christian secures blowout win against Gueydan
thread.title_full: Lafayette Christian secures blowout win against Gueydan

title: Lafayette Christian secures blowout win against Gueydan
persons: Bryce Badon Bryce Badon Paul Kieu
text:
Lafayette Christian secures blowout win against Gueydan From Staff Reports 11:37 p.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Bryce Badon Bryce Badon Paul Kieu, The AdvertiserTreven Kately (19), Eddy Suiza (74), Regan Miller (5), Colton Williams (21) and Bryce Badon will anchor the KnightsÃ¢Â?Â? offense. Offense Football picture day at Lafayette Christian Academy in Lafayette, Tuesday, Aug. 4, 2015. (Photo: Paul Kieu, The Advertiser) 
Lafayette Christian Academy’s offense exploded in a 49-0 victory against Gueydan Friday night. 
Freshman quarterback Zachary Clement had rushing touchdowns of 87, 62, 70 and 66-yards to finish with 330 rushing yards on 10 attempts. 
Bryce Badon caught two of Clement’s five completions for 58 yards and the Knights finished with 492 yards of offense on the night. 
LCA’s defense stepped up as well, with both Regan Miller and Wyatt Moreau pitching in 12 tackles, while the Knights’ scored two defensive touchdowns. 
Treven Kately had a 49-yard interception return for a touchdown in the second quarter before Hayden Lessard capped the scoring for the night with a 40-yard interception return. 
LCA will travel to Hanson next week, and Gueydan goes on the road to face Highland Baptist. 
Erath uses balanced rushing attack in win over Franklin 
Erath racked up 390 yards on 38 attempts and outlasted Franklin, 47-34, Friday night. 
Junior running back Elijah Mitchell led the Bobcats with 189 yards on 16 attempts, while Scott Moore chipped in 15 carries for 112 yards and two touchdowns. 
The Bobcats scored on every offensive possession they had in the game. 
Erath’s defense forced two turnovers in the game, which proved to be the difference maker. The Bobcats picked off a pass in the second quarter and opened the second half with a forced fumble. 
Franklin closed the gap late, scoring 16 points in the fourth quarter. 
New Iberia gets 200 th win in Lloyd G. Porter stadium 
The New Iberia Yellow Jackets didn’t even think they’d still be playing at Lloyd G. Porter Stadium any more. 
On Friday night anyway, it was a good thing. The Jackets exploded to a 45-21 win over Sam Houston to capture the program’s 200 th all-time win at the old stadium. 
New Iberia’s all-time record is now 200-170-8 at Lloyd G. Porter. 
The Jackets improved to 3-3 overall and 2-1 to remain in the hunt for the 3-5A title. 
Timothy Declouet was the star of the win, hitting on 26 of 36 passes for 362 yards and four touchdowns. 
Receiver Tyler Khammany also sparkled, catching six passes for 148 yards and two scores. 
Running back Aaron Bean added 126 yards and a score on 16 carries. 
Trevontai Thompson had 159 yards and two scores on 16 carries for Sam Houston. Read or Share this story: http://www.theadvertiser.com/story/sports/high-school/2015/10/10/lafayette-christian-secures-blowout-win-gueydan/73714106/ TOP VIDEOS
